verses.kjv: Then he called his twelve disciples together, and gave them power and authority over all devils, and to cure diseases.
verses.web: He called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.
verses.ct: Jesus called his 12 disciples together and gave them power and authority over all demons, along with the ability to cure diseases.

verses.kjv: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.
verses.web: He sent them out to preach God’s Kingdom and to heal the sick.
verses.ct: Then he sent them out to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Take nothing for your journey, neither staves, nor scrip, neither bread, neither money; neither have two coats apiece.
verses.web: He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey—no staffs, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money. Don’t have two coats each.
verses.ct: He told them, "Don't take anything for the journey — no walking stick, no bag, no bread, no money. Don't even pack an extra coat.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever house ye enter into, there abide, and thence depart.
verses.web: Into whatever house you enter, stay there, and depart from there.
verses.ct: Whatever house you enter, stay there until you leave that town.

verses.kjv: And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.
verses.web: As many as don’t receive you, when you depart from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.”
verses.ct: If a town won't welcome you, shake the dust off your feet as you leave — as a witness against them."

verses.kjv: And they departed, and went through the towns, preaching the gospel, and healing every where.
verses.web: They departed and went throughout the villages, preaching the Good News and healing everywhere.
verses.ct: So they set out, traveling from village to village, preaching the good news and healing people everywhere they went.

verses.kjv: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him: and he was perplexed, because that it was said of some, that John was risen from the dead;
verses.web: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him; and he was very perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead,
verses.ct: Herod the tetrarch heard about everything that was happening, and he was deeply troubled. Some people were saying that John had risen from the dead.

verses.kjv: And of some, that Elias had appeared; and of others, that one of the old prophets was risen again.
verses.web: and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen again.
verses.ct: Others claimed that Elijah had appeared, and still others said one of the ancient prophets had come back to life.

verses.kjv: And Herod said, John have I beheaded: but who is this, of whom I hear such things? And he desired to see him.
verses.web: Herod said, “I beheaded John, but who is this about whom I hear such things?” He sought to see him.
verses.ct: Herod said, "I had John beheaded. So who is this man I keep hearing about?" And he kept trying to see Jesus.

verses.kjv: And the apostles, when they were returned, told him all that they had done. And he took them, and went aside privately into a desert place belonging to the city called Bethsaida.
verses.web: The apostles, when they had returned, told him what things they had done. He took them and withdrew apart to a desert region of a city called Bethsaida.
verses.ct: When the apostles returned, they told Jesus everything they had done. He took them and withdrew privately to a remote area near the town of Bethsaida.

verses.kjv: And the people, when they knew it, followed him: and he received them, and spake unto them of the kingdom of God, and healed them that had need of healing.
verses.web: But the multitudes, perceiving it, followed him. He welcomed them, spoke to them of God’s Kingdom, and he cured those who needed healing.
verses.ct: But the crowds found out and followed him. He welcomed them, spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and healed those who needed healing.

verses.kjv: And when the day began to wear away, then came the twelve, and said unto him, Send the multitude away, that they may go into the towns and country round about, and lodge, and get victuals: for we are here in a desert place.
verses.web: The day began to wear away; and the twelve came and said to him, “Send the multitude away, that they may go into the surrounding villages and farms, and lodge, and get food, for we are here in a deserted place.”
verses.ct: As the day was winding down, the 12 came to him and said, "Send the crowd away so they can go to the surrounding villages and farms to find food and a place to stay. We're out here in the middle of nowhere."

verses.kjv: But he said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they said, We have no more but five loaves and two fishes; except we should go and buy meat for all this people.
verses.web: But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.” They said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people.”
verses.ct: But Jesus said, "You feed them." They replied, "All we have is 5 loaves of bread and 2 fish — unless you want us to go buy food for all these people."

verses.kjv: For they were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples, Make them sit down by fifties in a company.
verses.web: For they were about five thousand men. He said to his disciples, “Make them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”
verses.ct: There were about 5,000 men in the crowd. Jesus told his disciples, "Have them sit down in groups of about 50."

verses.kjv: And they did so, and made them all sit down.
verses.web: They did so, and made them all sit down.
verses.ct: They did as he said and got everyone seated.

verses.kjv: Then he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed them, and brake, and gave to the disciples to set before the multitude.
verses.web: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to the sky, he blessed them, broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the multitude.
verses.ct: Jesus took the 5 loaves and the 2 fish, looked up to heaven, blessed them, broke them into pieces, and handed them to the disciples to distribute to the crowd.

verses.kjv: And they did eat, and were all filled: and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets.
verses.web: They ate and were all filled. They gathered up twelve baskets of broken pieces that were left over.
verses.ct: Everyone ate and was completely satisfied. Afterward, the disciples picked up 12 baskets full of leftover pieces.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he was alone praying, his disciples were with him: and he asked them, saying, Whom say the people that I am?
verses.web: As he was praying alone, the disciples were with him, and he asked them, “Who do the multitudes say that I am?”
verses.ct: One time when Jesus was praying alone — with his disciples nearby — he asked them, "Who do the crowds say I am?"

verses.kjv: They answering said, John the Baptist; but some say, Elias; and others say, that one of the old prophets is risen again.
verses.web: They answered, “ ‘John the Baptizer,’ but others say, ‘Elijah,’ and others, that one of the old prophets has risen again.”
verses.ct: They answered, "Some say John the Baptist. Others say Elijah. And others think one of the ancient prophets has risen again."

verses.kjv: He said unto them, But whom say ye that I am? Peter answering said, The Christ of God.
verses.web: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”
verses.ct: "But who do you say I am?" he asked. Peter answered, "The Christ of God."

verses.kjv: And he straitly charged them, and commanded them to tell no man that thing;
verses.web: But he warned them, and commanded them to tell this to no one,
verses.ct: Jesus strictly warned them not to tell anyone this.

verses.kjv: Saying, The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be slain, and be raised the third day.
verses.web: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.”
verses.ct: He said, "The Son of Man must suffer many things. He will be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes. He will be killed, and on the 3rd day he will be raised to life."

verses.kjv: And he said to them all, If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.
verses.web: He said to all, “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.ct: Then he said to all of them, "If anyone wants to follow me, he must deny himself, take up his cross daily, and follow me.

verses.kjv: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: but whosoever will lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.
verses.web: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever will lose his life for my sake, will save it.
verses.ct: Whoever tries to hold on to his life will lose it, but whoever gives up his life for my sake will save it.

verses.kjv: For what is a man advantaged, if he gain the whole world, and lose himself, or be cast away?
verses.web: For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses or forfeits his own self?
verses.ct: What good is it if someone gains the whole world but loses or destroys himself?

verses.kjv: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he shall come in his own glory, and in his Father’s, and of the holy angels.
verses.web: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed, when he comes in his glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.
verses.ct: If anyone is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of that person when he comes in his glory and in the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.

verses.kjv: But I tell you of a truth, there be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God.
verses.web: But I tell you the truth: There are some of those who stand here who will in no way taste of death until they see God’s Kingdom.”
verses.ct: I'm telling you the truth: some of you standing here right now will not taste death before you see the kingdom of God."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass about an eight days after these sayings, he took Peter and John and James, and went up into a mountain to pray.
verses.web: About eight days after these sayings, he took with him Peter, John, and James, and went up onto the mountain to pray.
verses.ct: About 8 days after he said these things, Jesus took Peter, John, and James and went up on a mountain to pray.

verses.kjv: And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raiment was white and glistering.
verses.web: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became white and dazzling.
verses.ct: While he was praying, the appearance of his face changed, and his clothes became brilliant white, blazing with light.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there talked with him two men, which were Moses and Elias:
verses.web: Behold, two men were talking with him, who were Moses and Elijah,
verses.ct: Suddenly, 2 men appeared and were talking with him — they were Moses and Elijah.

verses.kjv: Who appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.
verses.web: who appeared in glory, and spoke of his departure, which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: They appeared in glory and spoke with Jesus about his departure, which he was about to carry out in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: and when they were awake, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.
verses.web: Now Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep, but when they were fully awake, they saw his glory, and the two men who stood with him.
verses.ct: Peter and the others had been overcome with sleep, but when they fully woke up, they saw his glory and the 2 men standing with him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they departed from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias: not knowing what he said.
verses.web: As they were parting from him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let’s make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah,” not knowing what he said.
verses.ct: As Moses and Elijah were about to leave, Peter blurted out, "Master, it's wonderful that we're here! Let us build 3 shelters — one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah." He didn't really know what he was saying.

verses.kjv: While he thus spake, there came a cloud, and overshadowed them: and they feared as they entered into the cloud.
verses.web: While he said these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered into the cloud.
verses.ct: While he was still speaking, a cloud rolled in and covered them. The disciples were terrified as the cloud surrounded them.

verses.kjv: And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
verses.web: A voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him!”
verses.ct: Then a voice came from the cloud: "This is my beloved Son. Listen to him!"

verses.kjv: And when the voice was past, Jesus was found alone. And they kept it close, and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen.
verses.web: When the voice came, Jesus was found alone. They were silent, and told no one in those days any of the things which they had seen.
verses.ct: When the voice had spoken, Jesus was standing there alone. The disciples kept this to themselves and told no one at that time what they had seen.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that on the next day, when they were come down from the hill, much people met him.
verses.web: On the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a great multitude met him.
verses.ct: The next day, when they came down from the mountain, a large crowd met them.

verses.kjv: And, behold, a man of the company cried out, saying, Master, I beseech thee, look upon my son: for he is mine only child.
verses.web: Behold, a man from the crowd called out, saying, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.
verses.ct: A man in the crowd shouted, "Teacher, I'm begging you — please look at my son! He's my only child.

verses.kjv: And, lo, a spirit taketh him, and he suddenly crieth out; and it teareth him that he foameth again, and bruising him hardly departeth from him.
verses.web: Behold, a spirit takes him, he suddenly cries out, and it convulses him so that he foams, and it hardly departs from him, bruising him severely.
verses.ct: A spirit seizes him and he suddenly screams. It throws him into convulsions until he foams at the mouth. It batters him and barely ever leaves him alone.

verses.kjv: And I besought thy disciples to cast him out; and they could not.
verses.web: I begged your disciples to cast it out, and they couldn’t.”
verses.ct: I begged your disciples to drive it out, but they couldn't."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you, and suffer you? Bring thy son hither.
verses.web: Jesus answered, “Faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "You faithless and twisted generation, how long must I stay with you and put up with you? Bring your son here."

verses.kjv: And as he was yet a coming, the devil threw him down, and tare him. And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and delivered him again to his father.
verses.web: While he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him violently. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
verses.ct: Even as the boy was coming forward, the demon slammed him to the ground and threw him into violent convulsions. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.

verses.kjv: And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God. But while they wondered every one at all things which Jesus did, he said unto his disciples,
verses.web: They were all astonished at the majesty of God. But while all were marveling at all the things which Jesus did, he said to his disciples,
verses.ct: Everyone was stunned by the mighty power of God. While they were all marveling at everything Jesus was doing, he said to his disciples,

verses.kjv: Let these sayings sink down into your ears: for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.
verses.web: “Let these words sink into your ears, for the Son of Man will be delivered up into the hands of men.”
verses.ct: "Let these words sink deep into your ears: the Son of Man is going to be handed over to men."

verses.kjv: But they understood not this saying, and it was hid from them, that they perceived it not: and they feared to ask him of that saying.
verses.web: But they didn’t understand this saying. It was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.
verses.ct: But they didn't understand what he meant. The meaning was hidden from them so they couldn't grasp it, and they were afraid to ask him about it.

verses.kjv: Then there arose a reasoning among them, which of them should be greatest.
verses.web: An argument arose among them about which of them was the greatest.
verses.ct: An argument broke out among the disciples about which of them was the greatest.

verses.kjv: And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child, and set him by him,
verses.web: Jesus, perceiving the reasoning of their hearts, took a little child, and set him by his side,
verses.ct: Jesus, knowing what they were thinking in their hearts, took a little child and had the child stand beside him.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me: for he that is least among you all, the same shall be great.
verses.web: and said to them, “Whoever receives this little child in my name receives me. Whoever receives me receives him who sent me. For whoever is least among you all, this one will be great.”
verses.ct: Then he told them, "Whoever welcomes this little child in my name welcomes me. And whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me. The one who is the least among all of you — that person is truly great."

verses.kjv: And John answered and said, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name; and we forbad him, because he followeth not with us.
verses.web: John answered, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we forbade him, because he doesn’t follow with us.”
verses.ct: John spoke up and said, "Master, we saw someone driving out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him because he isn't part of our group."

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto him, Forbid him not: for he that is not against us is for us.
verses.web: Jesus said to him, “Don’t forbid him, for he who is not against us is for us.”
verses.ct: Jesus told him, "Don't stop him. Whoever is not against you is for you."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the time was come that he should be received up, he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem,
verses.web: It came to pass, when the days were near that he should be taken up, he intently set his face to go to Jerusalem
verses.ct: As the time drew near for Jesus to be taken up to heaven, he resolutely set out for Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And sent messengers before his face: and they went, and entered into a village of the Samaritans, to make ready for him.
verses.web: and sent messengers before his face. They went and entered into a village of the Samaritans, so as to prepare for him.
verses.ct: He sent messengers ahead of him, and they entered a Samaritan village to prepare for his arrival.

verses.kjv: And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.
verses.web: They didn’t receive him, because he was traveling with his face set toward Jerusalem.
verses.ct: But the people there refused to welcome him because he was heading toward Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And when his disciples James and John saw this, they said, Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume them, even as Elias did?
verses.web: When his disciples, James and John, saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to command fire to come down from the sky, and destroy them, just as Elijah did?”
verses.ct: When his disciples James and John saw this, they said, "Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven to destroy them, just like Elijah did?"

verses.kjv: But he turned, and rebuked them, and said, Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of.
verses.web: But he turned and rebuked them, “You don’t know of what kind of spirit you are.
verses.ct: But Jesus turned and rebuked them. "You don't even realize what kind of spirit is driving you to say that," he said.

verses.kjv: For the Son of man is not come to destroy men’s lives, but to save them. And they went to another village.
verses.web: For the Son of Man didn’t come to destroy men’s lives, but to save them.” They went to another village.
verses.ct: "The Son of Man didn't come to destroy people's lives but to save them." Then they moved on to another village.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, as they went in the way, a certain man said unto him, Lord, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.
verses.web: As they went on the way, a certain man said to him, “I want to follow you wherever you go, Lord.”
verses.ct: As they were walking along the road, a man said to him, "Lord, I'll follow you wherever you go."

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto him, Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.
verses.web: Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes, and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Foxes have dens and birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head."

verses.kjv: And he said unto another, Follow me. But he said, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.
verses.web: He said to another, “Follow me!” But he said, “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”
verses.ct: To another man he said, "Follow me." But the man replied, "Lord, let me go home first and bury my father."

verses.kjv: Jesus said unto him, Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and preach the kingdom of God.
verses.web: But Jesus said to him, “Leave the dead to bury their own dead, but you go and announce God’s Kingdom.”
verses.ct: Jesus told him, "Let the dead bury their own dead. You go and proclaim the kingdom of God."

verses.kjv: And another also said, Lord, I will follow thee; but let me first go bid them farewell, which are at home at my house.
verses.web: Another also said, “I want to follow you, Lord, but first allow me to say good-bye to those who are at my house.”
verses.ct: Yet another person said, "Lord, I'll follow you, but first let me go say goodbye to my family."

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto him, No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.
verses.web: But Jesus said to him, “No one, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for God’s Kingdom.”
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "No one who puts his hand to the plow and then looks back is fit for the kingdom of God."
